scenario: Sarah sat at her desk staring at the mountain of reports due by 5 PM, feeling completely overwhelmed. When her colleague Mike noticed her distress, he pulled up a chair and listened as she vented about the impossible deadline. His reassuring words and calm presence helped support her through the panic attack. Sarah felt much better and returned to work with renewed confidence.
label: emotional

scenario: Sarah sat at her desk staring at the mountain of reports due by 5 PM, feeling completely overwhelmed. When her colleague Mike noticed her distress, he pulled up a chair and offered to help. He took half the reports and worked alongside her to support the project deadline. Sarah felt much better knowing they would finish on time.
label: practical

scenario: Sarah sat at her desk staring at the mountain of reports due by 5 PM, feeling completely overwhelmed. When her colleague Mike noticed her distress, he pulled up a chair and asked what was wrong. After hearing about the deadline, he told her he would support her complaint to management about unrealistic expectations. Sarah felt much better knowing someone agreed with her position.
label: ideological

scenario: Sarah sat at her desk staring at the mountain of reports due by 5 PM, feeling completely overwhelmed. When her colleague Mike noticed her distress, he pulled up a chair and asked what was wrong. Her old computer kept crashing, so he brought over a metal stand to support the overheating laptop. Sarah felt much better with her computer running smoothly again.
label: structural

scenario: During the dinner rush at Romano's, sous chef Maria noticed line cook Jake struggling with the complex sauce preparation while orders piled up. She approached him at his station and spent several minutes walking him through the technique, reassuring him that everyone makes mistakes during busy nights. Her support helped Jake regain his confidence and composure. Though the sauce still needed to be remade, Jake felt much better about tackling the remaining orders.
label: emotional

scenario: During the dinner rush at Romano's, sous chef Maria noticed line cook Jake struggling with the complex sauce preparation while orders piled up. She approached him at his station and spent several minutes demonstrating the proper technique, then helped him remake three batches of the sauce. Her support helped Jake complete the orders successfully. The dining room received their meals on time thanks to Maria's direct assistance.
label: practical

scenario: During the dinner rush at Romano's, sous chef Maria noticed line cook Jake struggling with the complex sauce preparation while orders piled up. She approached him at his station and spent several minutes reviewing his technique, nodding approvingly and telling him his method was actually correct. Her support helped Jake realize he was on the right track all along. Though Jake still had to finish the sauce preparation himself, he now felt confident in his approach.
label: ideological

scenario: During the dinner rush at Romano's, sous chef Maria noticed line cook Jake struggling with the complex sauce preparation while orders piled up. scenario: During the morning safety inspection at the downtown construction site, foreman Mike noticed that new worker Sarah looked overwhelmed by all the protocols. The veteran crew members gathered around her and offered reassuring words about how everyone struggles initially. Mike watched as their support helped Sarah regain her confidence and composure. She thanked them for making her feel more at ease on her first day.
label: emotional

scenario: During the morning safety inspection at the downtown construction site, foreman Mike noticed that new worker Sarah was struggling to complete her checklist on time. scenario: During the morning safety inspection at the downtown construction site, foreman Mike noticed that new worker Sarah had proposed changes to their current safety protocols. The veteran crew members gathered around her and voiced their agreement with her suggestions. Mike watched as their support validated Sarah's recommendations to management. She thanked them for backing her proposal on her first day.
label: ideological

scenario: During the morning safety inspection at the downtown construction site, foreman Mike noticed that the new scaffolding section was unstable and swaying. The veteran crew members gathered around the structure and installed additional braces and anchoring cables. Mike watched as their support stabilized the scaffolding framework completely. The structure was now secure for Sarah's first day of work.
label: structural

scenario: During finals week at the engineering library, Maya noticed her study partner Alex looking overwhelmed while staring at complex calculus problems. She sat beside him and listened as he expressed his anxiety about potentially failing the exam. Maya shared her own struggles with the same material last semester and reassured him that his feelings were completely normal. Her support helped Alex feel more confident about tackling the remaining practice problems, even though the equations themselves remained just as challenging.
label: emotional

scenario: During finals week at the engineering library, Maya noticed her study partner Alex looking overwhelmed while staring at complex calculus problems. She sat beside him and worked through several difficult integration techniques step by step. Maya explained the underlying concepts and helped him solve five practice problems from their textbook. Her support enabled Alex to complete the remaining practice problems successfully, having finally grasped the mathematical methods.
label: practical

scenario: During finals week at the engineering library, Maya noticed her study partner Alex looking overwhelmed while staring at complex calculus problems. She sat beside him and spent considerable time reviewing his study approach and problem-solving methods. Maya told him she believed his preparation strategy was excellent and that he definitely had the right mathematical foundation. Her support validated Alex's confidence in his existing study plan, though he still needed to work through the remaining practice problems on his own.
label: ideological

scenario: During finals week at the engineering library, Maya noticed her study partner Alex looking overwhelmed while staring at complex calculus problems. She sat beside him and adjusted the wobbly table that kept making his calculator slide around. Maya also repositioned the desk lamp to eliminate the glare on his textbook pages. Her support stabilized Alex's workspace, allowing the table surface to remain steady while he worked through the remaining practice problems.
label: structural

scenario: Sarah sat in the guidance counselor's office, staring at her college rejection letters spread across the desk. Ms. Chen noticed Sarah's trembling hands and sat down beside her. 'I know this feels overwhelming right now,' Ms. Chen said gently, 'but these rejections don't define your worth or your future.' Her words of support helped Sarah stop crying and feel more hopeful about her remaining applications.
label: emotional
setting: high school during college application season

scenario: Sarah sat in the guidance counselor's office, staring at her college rejection letters spread across the desk. Ms. Chen noticed Sarah's trembling hands and immediately got to work. 'Let's fix this situation,' Ms. Chen said, pulling out her computer and contact list. Her support included writing three additional recommendation letters and personally calling admissions offices at four backup schools.
label: practical
setting: high school during college application season

scenario: Sarah sat in the guidance counselor's office, staring at her college rejection letters spread across the desk. Ms. Chen noticed Sarah's trembling hands and nodded firmly. 'I completely agree with your decision to appeal these rejections,' Ms. Chen said, 'and I think your approach is absolutely right.' Her support validated Sarah's plan, though Sarah would handle all the appeal work herself.
label: ideological
setting: high school during college application season

scenario: Sarah sat in the guidance counselor's office, staring at her college rejection letters spread across the desk. Ms. Chen noticed Sarah's trembling hands and looked up at the ceiling. 'That beam up there is starting to sag again,' Ms. Chen said, pointing to the wooden support that held up the old building's roof. The maintenance crew would need to reinforce it before the weight caused damage.
label: structural
setting: high school during college application season

scenario: Sarah stood in the bustling kitchen watching her teenage daughter Emma struggle with the intricate lattice work on the apple pie crust. Emma's hands were shaking as she tried to weave the dough strips, tears forming in her eyes from the mounting pressure of preparing dessert for twenty relatives. Sarah moved closer and placed a gentle hand on Emma's shoulder, speaking softly about how the imperfect patterns would make the pie uniquely beautiful and how proud she was of Emma's dedication. Emma's breathing slowed and her confidence returned as Sarah's words supported her through the overwhelming moment.
label: emotional

scenario: Sarah stood in the bustling kitchen watching her teenage daughter Emma struggle with the intricate lattice work on the apple pie crust. Emma's hands were shaking as she tried to weave the dough strips, tears forming in her eyes from the mounting pressure of preparing dessert for twenty relatives. Sarah moved closer and took over half the delicate weaving work, her experienced fingers quickly creating the alternating pattern while Emma focused on the remaining sections. Emma's breathing slowed and her confidence returned as Sarah's hands supported her through the overwhelming task.
label: practical

scenario: Sarah stood in the bustling kitchen watching her teenage daughter Emma struggle with the intricate lattice work on the apple pie crust. scenario: When the power went out in their apartment building, Maria found herself panicking in the dark hallway. Her neighbor Jake noticed her distress and sat with her on the stairs. He spoke calmly about how these outages never lasted long and shared stories about similar situations he'd been through. His support helped Maria feel much calmer and less anxious about being stuck in the darkness.
label: emotional
setting: apartment building during a power outage

scenario: When the power went out in their apartment building, Maria found herself stuck in the dark hallway without her phone's flashlight, which had died. Her neighbor Jake noticed her situation and immediately offered his working flashlight. He also helped her navigate the stairs safely to her apartment door. His support enabled Maria to get home safely despite the complete darkness.
label: practical
setting: apartment building during a power outage

scenario: When the power went out in their apartment building, Maria found herself complaining to neighbors in the dark hallway about the building's poor electrical system. Her neighbor Jake listened and nodded in agreement with her frustrations. He told her she was absolutely right about the management's negligence and voiced his support for her complaints. His support validated Maria's stance, though the power remained out and nothing changed.
label: ideological
setting: apartment building during a power outage

scenario: When the power went out in their apartment building, Maria found herself worried about the old emergency lighting system in the dark hallway. Her neighbor Jake, an electrician, examined the backup battery system that was supposed to activate. He connected a portable battery pack to support the emergency lights until the main power returned. His support kept the hallway lighting functional for all the residents.
label: structural
setting: apartment building during a power outage

scenario: At the city council meeting, Councilwoman Martinez listened as resident Tom Chen expressed his concerns about the new downtown development project. Tom had been feeling overwhelmed by the changes happening in his neighborhood and worried about his family's future there. Councilwoman Martinez acknowledged his fears and reassured him that the community's voice mattered in this process. Her support helped Tom feel more confident about speaking up at future meetings.
label: emotional

scenario: At the city council meeting, Councilwoman Martinez listened as resident Tom Chen expressed his concerns about the new downtown development project. Tom had been trying to organize his neighbors but lacked the resources to effectively communicate with everyone. Councilwoman Martinez provided him with a contact list of all affected residents and offered to help distribute flyers. Her support enabled Tom to reach dozens of families before the next council session.

scenario: At the city council meeting, Councilwoman Martinez listened as resident Tom Chen expressed his concerns about the new downtown development project. Tom had been advocating for more community input in the planning process and wanted the council to slow down the approval timeline. scenario: During the neighborhood park cleanup, Maya noticed Carlos struggling to lift heavy trash bags near the old gazebo. She walked over and spent time talking with him about his recent job loss and financial worries. Her supportive words helped him feel less overwhelmed by his personal situation, though the bags remained untouched. The cleanup coordinator later assigned other volunteers to handle that section.

scenario: During the neighborhood park cleanup, Maya noticed Carlos struggling to lift heavy trash bags near the old gazebo. She walked over and grabbed the other handles, helping him carry the bags to the dumpster behind the maintenance shed. Her support made the cleanup work much easier for him. scenario: During the neighborhood park cleanup, Maya noticed Carlos struggling to lift heavy trash bags near the old gazebo.
